Classical.Structure: Suprachiasmatic Nucleus. A tiny region in the hypothalamus, above the optic chiasm.
Classical.Function: The 'master clock' of the body. Entrains the organism to the 24-hour light/dark cycle via light input from the retina.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A 'Quantum Chronometer'. The SCN is a quantum oscillator network. Its entrainment to light is a quantum sensing event mediated by cryptochromes (Radical Pair Mechanism), making it a quantum magnetometer that senses L6/L8 fields.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Conductor' of the body's orchestra, setting the tempo (circadian rhythm) to which all other organs must align.

Falsification_Hypotheses: The SCN's precision (drift < 1 sec/day) will be fully explained by classical oscillator models (which predict drift ~ 15 min/day).
The SCN's phase response curve (PRC) to light pulses will show no quantum enhancement (P_quantum = P_classical).
Experimental_Protocols: Measure the SCN's phase response curve (PRC) and test for quantum enhancement signatures.
Test for SCN sensitivity to weak magnetic fields, confirming the RPM.

KeyEquations_LaTeX: Circadian Hamiltonian: H_{circadian} = H_{core} + H_{solar} + H_{magnetic}
